posts.content:
Splitbus Nation is a bi-annual event in Wachtebeke (Belgium) for Volkswagen split screen vans. Last edition in 2014 there were about 113 buses and we expect more for next years show in 2016. The fifth edition will be held next summer on July 29, 30 and 31.

http://www.splitbusnation.be/index.php/en

We took at trip over to this show in 2014 and loved it, it's a real family event and even though it is small the atmosphere was fantastic and we can't wait to head back over next summer

The event as the name might suggest is based around Splitscreen buses but everyone is welcome, although the main show event on the Sunday is a display/show of Splitscreen buses only. All other vehicle's have to park in the main parking area just over the way. It is held at a proper camp site so you get proper facilities to use which makes a nice change from most shows I have attended over the years, this does mean though that you have to camp properly and not 'home is where you park it' style like most other shows.

Take a look at the link above for more information, they will slowly add more and more as time gets closer and they get more things booked and confirmed.

This is a great show and will defiantly be going back in 2016, I guess the the actual show is a one day event on the Sunday but a line up and cruise is organised on the Saturday to a VW related venue followed by a BBQ in the evening.

Its not to big and has a nice chilled out atmosphere with good camping facilities, If your looking for loud music and all night partying this not the one for you.

A few shots from the saturday.

Some nice photo's mate, especially the second from bottom one

A link to some more pics for people to take a look at from 2014 weekend.

http://hugoclaus.smugmug.com/SplitbusNa ... /i-J5PDHT7

Well that's our ferry booked for Splitbus Nation 2016 and looks like we are taking 4 vehicle's over this year in our group

Anyone else planning on going over ?
Would love to go but we'll be in the states with the bus for the summer.

Claushema wrote:Would love to go but we'll be in the states with the bus for the summer.


Now that sounds like my kinda holiday

Look forward to seeing your pics of your adventure

That was my goal to get my bus ready,but it looks like the show is a few months to soon.
So my new goal is the next show,with 2 years extra i think that will work.

Henk!!!
Yes mate we will be there again, deffently 4 buses with possible further 4, what day you going over ?

It's gonna be great. Things are progressing slowly but surely with the planning. Here's a link to the thread where I ramble on about it.


viewtopic.php?f=2&t=112305
we will be there for sure too! We love this show its so friendly and different and oldschool totally brilliant....

ziggy wrote:Yes mate we will be there again, deffently 4 buses with possible further 4, what day you going over ?


We can't have much time off work so going over early Friday morning from Dover and coming home Monday lunch. A flying visit yet again but well worth the trip over
For those who can stay a week, the weekend after is Spa Francorchamps! So you can have 2 killer shows in one trip!
The Splitbus Nation website went live last night and all details are now on there and taking bookings

Preparations are already in full swing, because soon it’s time for… Splitbus Nation 2016!

Splitbus Nation is a biennial event in Wachtebeke (Belgium) exclusively for VW splitbuses. In the previous edition there was 113 split buses and this year we expect a further growth. The fifth edition of Splitbus Nation will be on the 30th and 31th of July. On July 30th there is a wonderful guided tour! In the evening you can enjoy a delicious barbecue. On Sunday, July 31th you can start the day with a delicious breakfast, meeting and market!

Would you like to have the full experience of Splitbus Nation 2016? Then book your camping spot, barbecue and breakfast via our registration form!

We look forward to seeing you at Splitbus Nation 2016!
Splitbus Nation crew

Check out http://www.splitbusnation.be

Just over a week now before this show, hoping that the weather holds out and stays nice for everyone at an event that weekend.

Looking forward to this years cruise out on the Saturday, wonder where we will go this year
